name: Billy Cranston - True Blue Quiz | TV for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: When not fighting as a Power Ranger, what did Billy do for fun?
questions.correct: He was a tinkerer, often building new gadgets for the Rangers to use.
options: He baked cookies and cakes for the homeless.
questions.explanation:
He was a tinkerer, often building new gadgets for the Rangers to use.

	Billy was the best student among the Rangers, and a top scientist as well. He spent his free time conducting science experiments and building gadgets. Soon after the Rangers were given their powers, Billy invented the communicators and transporters used by the team.

questions.text: Which Zord did Billy pilot in the first season of "Mighty Morphin Power Rangers"?
questions.explanation:
Triceratops Dinozord.

	Billy, as the original blue Ranger, harnessed the power of the Triceratops. When the zords were upgraded in season 2 he took on the Unicorn Thunderzord and later the Wolf Ninjazord.

questions.text: During the "Mighty Morphin Alien Rangers" microseries (which only lasted five episodes) who turned Billy and the rest of the Rangers into children?
questions.explanation:
Master Vile.

	Master Vile was the father of Rita Repulsa. He came in during the final episodes of "Mighty Morphin Power Rangers" and served as the main villain for the "Mighty Morphin Alien Rangers" microseries that bridged the gap before "Power Rangers Zeo" debuted.

questions.text: Why did Billy give up his powers?
questions.correct: The Zeo crystal only had enough power for five Rangers.
options: He was moving away to college.
He broke his leg and couldn't be a Ranger.
He lost his power coin and the ability to morph in a fight with a monster.
questions.explanation:
The Zeo crystal only had enough power for five Rangers.

	There had been six Power Coins, and hence six Rangers. When the Rangers started to draw their power from the Zeo Crystal instead of the coins, one of the Rangers had to leave the team. Billy announced that he could be of more help in the command center serving in an advisory capacity.

questions.text: Billy eventually left Earth entirely in order to spend more time with his loved one.
questions.explanation:
True.

	He had initially travelled to Aquatar in order to work on a cure for a medical ailment he was facing.  While on their planet he worked closely with Cestra and the two fell in love. He elected to stay there instead of return to Earth.

questions.text: Other than being the original blue Ranger, which other color Ranger was Billy during "Mighty Morphin Power Rangers"?
questions.explanation:
Pink.

	For a single episode, "Switching Places", Billy and Kimberly switched bodies. That meant that Kimberly had his body, complete with his Power Coin and he had hers.  During that episode they morphed into each other's Ranger suits and piloted each other's Zords.

questions.text: Billy, a member of Mensa, was also a member of the Angel Grove High School debate team, science club, math club and the chess club.
questions.explanation:
True.

	BIlly was involved in nearly every "nerdy" activity the high school put on. He also spent time taking martial arts classes, and volunteering with the youth in the community.

questions.text: Who was Billy dating in the episode "Peace, Love and Woe"?
questions.explanation:
Marge.

	Marge was the only option who wasn't a Ranger at some point. Billy never showed any romantic interest in his teammates.  Marge was a short-lived character, only appearing in a handful of episodes. During this episode she was kidnapped by Madame Woe and had to be rescued by Billy.

questions.text: What weapon did Billy use during season 1 of "Mighty Morphin Power Rangers"?
questions.explanation:
Power Lance.

	The Power Sword was the red Ranger's weapon. The daggers went to the yellow Ranger, the bow to the pink Ranger and the axe to the black Ranger.

questions.text: Which zord was Billy piloting when he single-handedly bested the villain Brick Bully?
questions.explanation:
Blue Shogunzord.

	The blue Shogunzord was the only of the Shogunzords to ever be seen defeating a monster on it's own. The Shogunzords were used as alternate Zords along with the Ninja Zords in season three of "Mighty Morphin Power Rangers".
